results.title: Sinatra: portrait of an album
results.brief_description: An inside studio view of an album being produced by the singing legend Frank Sinatra in collaboration with the talented musician and arranger, Quincy Jones. This fascinating documentary provides interviews and commentary by those involved in helping to create the album “L.A. is my lady” including lyricists Alan and Marilyn Bergman, producer Phil Ramone, and musicians Lionel Hampton, George Benson, Frank Foster and Steve Gadd. Also features a cameo appearance and personal commentary by a youthful Michael Jackson. Describes the tension and electricity that comes with the energetic and demanding Sinatra and the mutual admiration and respect the singer and the musicians have for each other.

results.title: Sinatra: a passionate life
results.brief_description: Sinatra: A passionate life is a loving tribute to the late Frank Sinatra. It provides an excellent biographical overview of the singer, actor and all-round performer, ranging from his childhood years to retirement. We are introduced to Sinatra’s family, his place of birth, his admiration for Bing Crosby, his initial rise to fame, his huge success during World War II, his work in the film and TV industries, his Vegas years and experience with the Brat Pack, and so on. Interviews with numerous colleagues and close friends are interweaved with archival footage, photos and film excerpts. The archival footage is especially splendid including such rare and classic moments as Sinatra and Elvis Presley on live television performing each other’s songs or Dean Martin and Sammy Davis Jnr carrying out their legendary Brat Pack routines at the Sands casino in Las Vegas. Though completed just prior to Sinatra’s passing, “Sinatra: A passionate life” is overall both a fitting testament to the man’s unique talent, career achievements and influence and a record of the eras in which he performed.

results.title: Sin the movie (D)
results.creator_credit: ADV Films, Andrew Orjuela and Yasunori Urata
results.brief_description: Based on a popular video game, Sin the Movie is a compelling, action-packed tale set in Earth’s dystopic future. The city of Freeport has been rocked by a number of unexplained abductions involving a mutant humanoid. Colonel John Blade, leader of the elite strike force, Hardcorps, makes it his business to solve the mystery after one of his team is murdered by the monster. His efforts lead him to Sintek Industries, a multibillion dollar corporation headed by Elexis Sinclaire, brilliant biochemist and vicious vixen. When an adopted child, Elyse, is kidnapped, John and JC, the sister of his dead team-member, join forces to destroy the mutant, and stop Elexis from unleashing a genetically-engineered apocalypse upon the city. The director of this animation, Yasunori Urata, has been linked with a number of other important anime works, and is renowned for his stories, which combine human drama with spectacular action.

results.title: Simultaneous equations
results.brief_description: Examines simultaneous equations and inequations, and provides a basis for studying linear programming. Film No 2506. From the series “Vision in Mathematics”.

results.title: Simpson's Christmas special; Bart gets an F.
results.brief_description: In “The Simpsons Christmas Special” the family Christmas money has to be spent removing Bart’s tattoo. Homer attempts to find extra work in order to buy the Christmas gifts the family are demanding. In “Bart gets an F”, Bart is in danger of repeating fourth grade because of his inability to pass the exams. His hilarious attempts to hoodwink his teachers makes for a very entertaining episode of “The Simpsons”.

results.title: Simply making jewellery
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Sam Bryan and Ting Barrow
results.brief_description: Patricia Meyerowitz of New York City shows how she creates unique items of jewellery using inexpensive objects found in hardware stores, art and garment supply stores and elsewhere.

results.title: Simplification
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Film Junior and Soren Melson
results.brief_description: Simplification in manufacturing and the consequent benefits to producer and consumer. How standardisation of sizes, reduction of the number of sizes and types of an article produced have resulted in smoother work flow, greater specialisation and reduced handling costs. Examples from the wood industry, where simplification has enabled well-designed furniture to be produced at very reasonable cost, while standard sizes of barrel staves and fruit and fish cases enable mills to use scrap wood and slack time knowing that the product can be readily sold as required. Stresses the relation between planned production, consumer needs and advertising. English soundtrack.

results.title: Simple plants: the algae

results.title: Simple plants: Algae and fungi
results.brief_description: Descibes major characteristics of simple plants and shows how they differ from higher plants; shows their natural habitat; explains major differences between algae and fungi; and points out diverse human uses of algae and fungi.
